body: @josehernandezfintecheandomx is this being worked on?
Let's review this against wider requirements in communication w other Fineract users
@josehernandezfintecheandomx can we use the full name of "delinquency" instead of "dlqncy"? Other than that, looks good.

> @josehernandezfintecheandomx can we use the full name of "delinquency" instead of "dlqncy"? Other than that, looks good.

@galovics It has been renamed as you suggested. Thanks

> hi @josehernandezfintecheandomx,
> 
> 1. Please confirm whether avro schema changes are also needed for this configuration at this point.
> 2. Please also add required swagger changes for LoanProductApi.
> 3. Rest looks good to me.

Yes all of them has been updated
LGTM
LGTM (I am not the author of this PR, i just reraised it)
fixed spotlessCheck issue
@abhinav7sinha please squash the commits

> @abhinav7sinha please squash the commits

The other commit wasn't supposed to be a part of this PR. I've removed it now
@galovics Abhinav fixed your change request... unblocking the PR to merge... FYI.

Long awaited, thanks: 

![Alt Text](https://media0.giphy.com/media/ietk9bNd6xIsOdXJHo/200w.webp?cid=ecf05e47e5dt0p2z1ougqswjamwmbsut91mueufi7zrp00oz&ep=v1_gifs_search&rid=200w.webp&ct=g)

Conflicts resolved.
This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.
@SubhamKrGuptaDev please provide the Fineract Jira ticket as a prefix in your PR title ("FINERACT-1234: ...")

@faheem205 ... this doesn't seem to be related to a Fineract Jira ticket... could you please provide one (if it doesn't exist in Apache Jira) and change the PR title ("FINERACT-1234: ..."). Please make sure to use the exact pattern that (almost) everyone else uses. Thanks.
@b0c1 @marta-jankovics Please review!
@SubhamKrGuptaDev please look at the other PRs and follow the same pattern for the PR title... "FINERACT-XXXX: Title of the Jira ticket"

@tabrez-fiter ... don't want to appear too picky... but uppercase "FINERACT" (not capitalized as you did) and no additional space before the colon.... just look at the other PRs. Thanks for paying attention to these details (there are some tools setup in Jira that depend on being accurate here). I've corrected the title.

@jogathogo builds are failing with the following: Apache Rat audit failure - 421 unapproved licenses, please check and fix this.
Also, please squash the commits into only 1 commit.
@faheem205 PR is conflicting, please resolve it
Done in FINERACT-2009
Done in FINERACT-2009
@adamsaghy @galovics, what's the process for me to pick up ownership of finishing this change?
TLDR... Not needed it more
TLDR... Not needed it more

Still need to verify that the docker-compose.yml file is working... at the moment failing with this message:

```
Caused by: org.apache.fineract.infrastructure.event.external.exception.ExternalEventConfigurationNotFoundException: All external events are not configured
```

> Still need to verify that the docker-compose.yml file is working... at the moment failing with this message:
> 
> ```
> Caused by: org.apache.fineract.infrastructure.event.external.exception.ExternalEventConfigurationNotFoundException: All external events are not configured
> ```

Found the reason why this is not working. Gradle cache needs to be removed with `rm -rf .gradle` and then execute `./gradlew :fineract-provider:clean :fineract-provider:jibDockerBuild -x tes`.
@reluxa ... you were right... there was a test checking for that exception message... fixed it. Thanks for the help.

Good day, am failing to import LoanRepayment on fineract using template. This is the screenshot of my template download after it fails to upload the records. 

![Monosnap 7d0ab762-b2e1-42f7-86d4-974a626f23f6 xls ](https://github.com/apache/fineract/assets/136825421/3f7437fb-4c50-4c43-b067-4dc852ca638c)

Thank you, your support is highly appreciated.
@reluxa is this intended to be a downgrade in terms of version number? @ezolnbl-dpc mentioned some security issue... could you confirm?
I'm going to close this one, because there is already a major refactoring of the whole Docker Compose files on the way here: https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/3568
@ismoilovdevml ... and please next time: no pull request without a Jira ticket... otherwise making releases and changelogs is getting really a lot of work. Thank you.
This is all been taken care of in https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/3563
This is all been taken care of in https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/3563
This is still needed for the next release.

@tabrez-fiter please fix the license header issue. One more request: please hold this one back until we have created release 1.9.0; I am not 100% sure about the backward compatibility of this. Let's merge this after and release for 1.10.0 (marked Jira ticket accordingly).
Please don't merge this one before we've created release 1.9.0. Let's target 1.10.0. Jira tickets updated.
Please don't merge this one before we've created release 1.9.0. Let's target 1.10.0. Jira tickets updated.
@tabrez-fiter ... please squash the 2 commits into one.
... ah, just realized that misread the versions. Thanks.

The code change seems to have no consequences (i. e. is not used anywhere). Note: we are already using Lombok annotations here; if we really wanted  an all args constructor we should use the Lombok annotation (one liner).
This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.

body: @marta-jankovics Can you please help me understand where is the logic which makes the transaction order to be correct? I am not sure, i see it :/
LGTM
@galovics doing this type of stuff already as part of: https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/3563. FYI
@reluxa FYI

Have you covered the below scenarios as well? 

- When loan goes into pause delinquency started (consider the design for other programs like re-age, payment holiday starts)
- When loan comes out of pause delinquency ended (consider the design for other programs like re-age, payment holiday ends)

According to the delinquency event shall be emitted in this case too.

Update: 
We have discussed this with @ruchiD, and came to the conclusion that there is a dependency on @taskain7's story which calculates whether the COB should be kicked off or not. That is the point where these events shall be triggered in order to cover the above two scenarios. I will update @taskain7 's ticket just to make sure it won't be forgotten.

@daviestobialex Hi
Thank you for your contribution!
However there are a couple things you need to do before we can review this PR:
- Please rebase your branch with the latest develop branch of apache fineract
- Please squash your commits: 1PR 1 commit is the general rule!
- Please be sure your PR only contains the relevant changes
- Please add a unit test / integration test to prove your solution!

### Edited/Blocked Notification

Renovate will not automatically rebase this PR, because it does not recognize the last commit author and assumes somebody else may have edited the PR.

You can manually request rebase by checking the rebase/retry box above.

  **Warning**: custom changes will be lost.

performed_via_github_app.name: Forking Renovate
performed_via_github_app.description:
![header](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/whitesource_renovate_660_220.jpg)

"Forking Renovate" is the sister app to Mend's [Renovate Bot](https://github.com/apps/renovate) app. The difference is that Forking Renovate operates using forks of repositories instead of as a collaborator, so needs only read-only permissions rather than read-write. It works on public (e.g. open source) repositories only.

Please see the Renovate Bot page and documentation for further details.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`. You can also ignore all major, minor, or patch releases for a dependency by adding an [`ignore` condition](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/supply-chain-security/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#ignore) with the desired `update_types` to your config file.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

@josehernandezfintecheandomx Please find a way to fetch the Notes into the InterOpData as without it, it is a breaking change.

Please also check the spotless failures!

Also please have only 1 commit only! If you need you can squash them locally before!

>

> 
> Fineract modularisation tracked in this story: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-1932
>
